subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: What does it do?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01B8_01CA8F9C.BA6DAB20
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I think it's completely subjective, which is why different people hear diff=
erent things. Also why it will never be scientifically proven, or stand up =
against any tests.

To science, it will never be anything more then audible=
 pareidolia.

I am not saying that's a bad thing Frank :)

  ----- Original=
 Message ----- 
  From: Tom 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursda=
y, January 07, 2010 12:57 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: What does it do?


  =
  

  The fact that the operator CAN and DOES make recordings and files of =
understandable words and phrases shows that we are dealing with an OBJECTIV=
E rather than a subjective phenomenon here. Two things appear to be going o=
n though. 
  First there is an actual voice modulated signal. Different peo=
ple who listen to it often hear the same thing. The sound is not perfect an=
d is very noisy, so that would explain others who cannot hear the message.
=
  The second thing is that some people can listen to the noise as a "random=
 field", and with a slightly altered state of mind, this field will induce =
latent "mediumship" ability in the operator and he or she will get a lot mo=
re information and voice material than another listener.

  Note that the c=
ontent random fields have little or nothing in common with whatever imagery=
 or sounds may be percieved from them. They simply enhance the user to acce=
ss psychic information that, while even not being a "psychic" allows him to=
 get info normally innaccessable to him/her.
  If there is any objective pe=
rcieved sound similar to what is heard by others impressed upon the backgro=
und noise, it might be due to the spirit who is speaking being PRESENT. Tha=
t entity would then be able to get the message through to the operator Psyc=
hicly on another level. that the words are also in the noise would be a co-=
incidence.

  I work with VISUAL random fields---The imagery, while clear, =
is formed in my mind/eye system , so I cannot photograph it. Some of this E=
VP background noise may be working the same way too---formed in the Mind/EA=
R system. This is only heard by the primary operator and likely cannot be r=
ecorded to a file. 
  But some random field stuff IS objective--for example=
, using a random backdrop for ghost photos makes the ghosts easier to, and =
more often appear in a photo. This is equavalent to the EVP that people can=
 hear on the recorded file.

  I will discuss and explain random field theo=
ry itself, later, in its own posting. 

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Z=
ack Widup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:
  >
  > Just a guess, since I don't have a=
 lot of experience with this - probably
  > the mesages are meant for one u=
ser and it's best if one user listens at a
  > time.
  > 
  > It could be t=
hat some messages come through that are meant for multiple
  > users at onc=
e. I've heard the same things as Frank in some of the recordings
  > he's p=
osted. FWIW.
  > 
  > Zack
  > 
  > On Thu, Jan 7, 2010 at 12:51 PM, Rj <ra=
sterer@...> wrote:
  > 
  > >
  > >
  > > Thanks Zack. So how do you see no=
t asking it questions squaring with
  > > Frank's comment of "It's not the =
device, it's the user. The messages
  > > received are for the user, and ra=
rely does anyone hear the same thing as the
  > > original listener."
  > >=

 which

 and shape to communicate with the user.
  > >> The messages received are f=
or the user, and rarely does anyone hear the same
  > >> thing as the origi=
nal listener."

t's a freaking radio! The tuning is swept across the entire band, AM or
  >=
 >> FM, the resulting bits of speech, music, and noise are used by the enit=
ites
  > >> as a raw material to build their voices from. The sweep can be =
linear,
  > >> random, or manual, and it does not have to cover the entire =
broadcast band.
  > >> This is one method and device for providing the raw =
audio, and if you're
  > >> tesitng to see if it's just broadcast fragments=
, consider this-the concept
  > >> is the same as EVPmaker, EVPmaker runs o=
n a computer, the entities
  > >> manipulate that raw audio *inside* the co=
nmputer, and if you think stray
  > >> RF is going to get *inside* the hard=
 drive and mix with the audio file
  > >> you have no clue how any technolo=
gy works.
  > >>

e user. The messages
  > >> received are for the user, and rarely does anyo=
ne hear the same thing as the

=

ctive
  > >> listeners)) and expect to get an unbiased/honest test. No two =
people hear
  > >> the same, so an "objective listener" is an insult to mos=
t people doing this
  > >> work.
  > >>

anyone - what is a good official statement on what the Frank's
  > >>> box =
